title: How to play piano on any given song - Quora

response.answer_text: Before you can successfully learn to play piano by ear, you need to have some beginner piano training under your belt. Many people go the traditional route and take lessons from an in-person teacher with plenty of music theory. But that's not the fastest or simplest way. Many people believe it is hard to learn to read music. It isn't! In fact, reading music is a little like learning to read another language, but much easier than most languages to learn!. In fact, if you are reading this - you can learn how to read music with just a little effort. Go to my Profile and you can find all about Play Piano material there...

Well!  I recently found something rather perfect for someone like you, starting out.. Check  THIS out: Synthesia, Piano for Everyone Here's how it looks in operation -- [this is a you tube vid posted by a teacher, using this software]   See?  They have a free trial option, and 150 songs available for free, plus a large library.  You purchase those.. Anyway - Looks really good, like I said. Give it a shot.. Let me know how it works out for you. Good Luck!

Having an ear to be able to play music from simply hearing it is truly a gift, and one we want to nurture in our children. But it also can be problematic when it prevents students from learning their music fundamentals. I think piano is easy to learn, but incredibly difficult to master. Anyone can learn to pick out a few chords and melodies, and it won't take long. Playing an easy piano song or two is far from un-achievable. Having finesse on the keys is a whole other ballgame. Go to my Profile and you can find all about Learn Piano material there...

There are a number of downloadable free arrangements of various Songs (in the literal sense of Lyric based); and I have taught these to teenagers on their tablets instead of Sheet Music.  I personally insist on the reading of Staff Notation (because I'm an educator!); however, one of my pupils showed me how some Songs show a keyboard which highlights where the fingers should go. Of course, there is always the option of trying to pick a Song out by ear, in which case you will need to break it down  by  stages.

First Find in which Scale the Song Should go in. You can normally Find it by Trying out Various individual notes on ur Piano. And See if any note u play match the note in the song.  So Play the song on ur speakers and try to play some the piano pieces of it on it. Once u understand what scale it goes. Perhaps you can easily Create an instrumental Piano of that Song.
